intro: Serapias neglecta subsp. ionica, commonly known as the Ionian serapias, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers with a distinctive red or orange center. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in some regions.
